newsitem.title: USA: Crown Casino to sell land for $15.25 mln.
newsitem.headline: Crown Casino to sell land for $15.25 mln.

text.p: Crown Casino Corp said on Tuesday that it presently has a contract to sell an 18.6 acre tract of land in Las Vegas for $15.25 million.
Closing of the transaction, which is subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, is scheduled for September 1997, the company said.

In addition to the Las Vegas land, Crown presently owns a 49 percent interest in Casino Magic Neuquen S.A. which operates two casinos in Argentina and 79 percent of Concorde Acceptance Corp which was formed in June 1997 to originate, purchase, service and sell sub-prime mortgage loans.
As well as developing these two businesses, Crown said in a statement that it continues to focus on pursuing other business opportunities.
